case_vignette: A 64-year-old man with a history of numerous nonmelanoma skin cancers presents with a lesion on the left side of his nose that was first noticed about 6 months ago and is slowly growing. The lesion is not painful or itchy. The patient has not tried any medications on the lesion. The patient wears eyeglasses and the nose pad of his eyeglasses rubs on the lesion. On physical examination, an erythematous papule is found on the left superior nasal sidewall with a central depression. The patient is a nonsmoker and has a history of sun exposure. The patient has a history of actinic keratoses on the face and scalp. The patient has a history of basal cell carcinoma on the left cheek. The patient has a history of squamous cell carcinoma on the left ear. The patient has a history of melanoma on the left arm. The patient has a history of Merkel cell carcinoma on the left arm. The patient has a history of multiple basal cell carcinomas on the left arm. The patient has a history of multiple squamous cell carcinomas on the left arm. The patient has a history of multiple actinic keratoses on the left arm. The patient has a history of multiple actinic keratoses on the left cheek. The patient has a history of multiple actinic keratoses on the scalp. The patient has a history of multiple basal cell carcinomas on the scalp. The patient has a history of multiple squamous cell carcinomas on the scalp. The patient has a history of multiple actinic keratoses on the face. The patient has a history of multiple basal cell carcinomas on the face. The patient has a history of multiple squamous cell carcinomas on the face. The patient has a history of multiple Merkel cell carcinomas on the face. The patient has a history of multiple melanomas on the face. The patient has a history of multiple melanomas on the left arm. The patient has a history of multiple melanomas on the left ear. The patient has a history of multiple melanomas on the left cheek. The patient has a history of multiple melanomas on the left side of the head. The patient has a history of multiple melanomas on the scalp.
